column4: Can anyone direct to to a tutorial that helps me use the VGA ouput on my laptop to display custom resolutions? I keep having problems with virtual resolutions
xrandr --output VGA --mode 1280x1024
i have tried that i need the vga-out to do cutom resolutions like 1280x720. it doesnt recognize that resolution
might want to try to add a mode to xrandr with --newmode
do I type in the new resolution after --newmode ?
typing in xrandr --output VGA --newmode 1280x720_60.00 just gives me a list of xrandr options
when you do just xrandr is your resolution listed anywhere?
try xrandr --addmode VGA 1280x720
no 1280x720 isnt listed. I tried gtf 1280 720 60
with xrandr --newmode you have to specify modeline like this one  "1600x1200" 132.000 1600 1608 1672 1776 1200 1205 1215 1239 +hsync +vsync
this tool should be able to assist you http://xtiming.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/xtiming.pl
addmode vga 1280x720 couldnt find the mode.
yea you'll have to --newmode first, then --addmode VGA nameofmode
thanks ill look at the site. but the new mode with the correct info didn work, i got a badname error
actually scratch that, xrandr --newmode "1600x1200" 132.000 1600 1608 1672 1776 1200 1205 1215 1239 +hsync +vsync
that should work
great it made the new mode, so now i need to add mode for output vga?
yes xrandr --addmode VGA "1600x1200"
awesome! thanks, let me see how this works with my tv
after you added the mode it should show up under VGA output when you run xrandr with no arguments
